hanzi-su-wiki:
漬

Значения

Вымачивать, солить, мариновать; увлажнять, смачивать; просаливаться, быть выдержанным

Мнемоника

Поливай рис отстоявшейся водой 氵, не содержащей ила строго по инструкции, иначе будешь наказан 責.

Варианты

渍
purpleculture_pinyin:
zì
to soak; to be stained; stain; floodwater
замочить; быть окрашенным; пятно; паводковая вода
rtega_mnemonic:
漬漬RS
渍渍		soak, steep, dye, stains, sodden
  • being blamed 責 that something got soaked in water 氵 while in reality thorns 龶 pierced the protective clothing
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 渍)
Pictophonetic: 責 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 責 [ zé ] one's responsibility, duty
heisig_constituent: pickling, water, water droplets, water pistol, blame, grow up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
koohiiStory1: When pickling you MUST use distilled water! When it doesn´t come out right, generally it is the water that is to blame.
koohiiStory2: Bad water is to blame for the process of pickling.
kunYomi: つ.ける、つ.かる、-づ.け、-づけ
jp_example_words: 漬ける(つける): soak, pickle
jp_readingExamples: 漬かる (つ.かる), 漬ける (つ.ける)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Take some tsunami water and sacrifice the life of a shellfish to make a liquid you can pickle in. All pickling liquids are made from 1 part tsunami and 1 part murdered shellfish.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine stabbing a shellfish and dropping it in some water you collected from a tsunami so that you can make your own pickles.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You can only pickle two (つ) things with the life of one shellfish. Thats a lot of dead critters for not a lot of delicious pickles. Make sure you get a lot of shellfish if you want a full jar.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the two pickles that shellfish life got you. They're gonna be the best pickles ever!
Ru_Notes:
Не путать: 積 (つむ、セキ объём, произведение), 績 (み、セキ достижения), 債 (サイ долг).
Не путать: 清 (きよい、セイ、ショウ чистый), 精(セイ жизненная энергия; дух, душа; энергия, сила; чистота).
Не путать: 潰 (つぶす、カイ крушить).
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), ハ, 土 (земля), 汁 (суп), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Ru_trainchinese:
zì: (графема) пятно; паводковые воды в низине
zì: (глаг) быть испачканным (чем-л.); вымачивать в, пропитывать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the water (氵) that would torture (責) is for pickling
humanum_full_description_en:
From " water " to " responsibility " sound. The original meaning is immersion. "Shuowen": "Stain, retting. From the water, blame." Duan Yucai's note: "It is impregnated." Such as "Book of Rites. "Nei Ze": "If you pick up beef, you must kill the new ones, and if you cut it thinly, you will never be right." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "Japanese Book A Type" Jian 113zheng II: "You can stain rice into wine, and the wine is beautiful."

" Stain " means staining or contamination. Such as "Zhou Li. Kao Gong Ji. "Zhong's": "Zhong's dyed feathers with Zhuzhan Dan, which burns in March, and stains it." Zheng Xuan's note: "Steam the feathers to stain the feathers. The stains are still stained." "Han Shu. "The Official Biography of the Officials": "Today the king is close to the small group, and the evil is gradually stained. The chance of survival and death must not be careless."

" Stain " also means disease. Such as "Lu's Spring and Autumn. "Successful People": "When you travel, you can eat from the car to see the loneliness, old, weak, sick, poor, and melancholic. Those who are poor and sorrowful will eat on their own." Gao Yin noted: "Stains are also sick."

" Stain " means wetness. "Guang Yun. "Zhiyun": "Stain, infiltrate." Tang Dynasty Yin Yaofan "Send a guest to Wu": "Clothes are stained by the rain and the boat enters the fragrance of rice and flowers." Liang Zhangju of the Qing Dynasty "You Yandang Diary": "Hundreds of stones are folded into dozens The disciple is Anchan Valley, and everyone is climbing from the moss-stained stone slippery."

" Stain " can mean the accumulation of dirt on an object, such as one of the three poems of Su Shi's "Xu Piao Piao" in the Northern Song Dynasty: "Dust stains rain tung leaves, frosty wind willow twigs." It can also mean stains accumulated on objects, such as Ming Dynasty Tang Xianzu "Peony Pavilion. "Resurrection": "Look at the dust stains on the front, and there is no half a meter of worms in the oblique space." Chapter 33 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "Madam Wang is holding Baoyu, but he is pale and weak, wearing a green gauze coat underneath. All are blood stains."

" Qing " also means the appearance of rain or tears. "Class articles. The Ministry of Water: "Stains, rain, and rain." Such as Chen Ruyuan in the Ming Dynasty "Golden Lotus. Save it: "White hair is sad, green hills are soaked in tears." Qing Dynasty Deliang "Lonely Flower": "Rain stains can be appreciated, and the wind can't help it."
humanum_short_description_en: From " water " to " responsibility " sound. The original meaning is immersion.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「責」聲。本義是浸泡。《說文》：「漬，漚也。从水，責聲。」段玉裁注：「謂浸漬也。」如《禮記．內則》：「漬取牛肉，必新殺者，薄切之，必絕其理。」《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡113正貳：「可以漬米為酒，酒美。」

　　「漬」表示濡染、沾染。如《周禮．考工記．鍾氏》：「鍾氏染羽，以朱湛丹秫，三月而熾之，淳而漬之。」鄭玄注：「蒸之以漬羽。漬，猶染也。」《漢書．循吏傳》：「今大王親近群小，漸漬邪惡所習，存亡之機，不可不慎也。」

　　「漬」也表示疾病。如《呂氏春秋．順民》：「時出行路，從車載食，以視孤寡老弱之漬病困窮顏色愁悴不贍者，必身自食之。」高誘注：「漬，亦病也。」

　　「漬」表示濕潤。《廣韻．寘韻》：「漬，浸潤。」唐代殷堯藩〈送客遊吳〉：「衣逢梅雨漬，船入稻花香。」清代梁章鉅〈遊雁蕩日記〉：「石磴數百級折作數十盤者為安禪谷，同人皆從漬苔石滑中賈勇而登。」

　　「漬」既可表示塵垢積在物體上，如北宋蘇軾〈虛飄飄〉三首之一：「塵漬雨桐葉，霜飛風柳條。」亦可表示積在物體上的污跡，如明代湯顯祖《牡丹亭．回生》：「你看正面上那些兒塵漬，斜空處沒半米蚍蜉。」《紅樓夢》第33回：「王夫人抱着寶玉，只見他面白氣弱，底下穿着一條綠紗小衣，一片皆是血漬。」

　　「清」還表示雨水或眼淚灑落之貌。《類篇．水部》：「漬、洓，雨零皃。」如明代陳汝元《金蓮記．便省》：「白髮傷心，青山漬淚。」清代德亮〈孤花〉：「雨漬猶堪賞，風吹略不禁。」

④地面的積水：漬水。漬澇。

Lesson: 40 frameNoV4: 1545 frameNoV6: 1665 Strokes: 14 Jouyou Grade: JH JLPT: 1
漬ける(つける): soak, pickle

從「 水 」，「 責 」聲。本義是浸泡。《說文》：「漬，漚也。从水，責聲。」段玉裁注：「謂浸漬也。」如《禮記．內則》：「漬取牛肉，必新殺者，薄切之，必絕其理。」《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡113正貳：「可以漬米為酒，酒美。」 「 漬 」表示濡染、沾染。如《周禮．考工記．鍾氏》：「鍾氏染羽，以朱湛丹秫，三月而熾之，淳而漬之。」鄭玄注：「蒸之以漬羽。漬，猶染也。」《漢書．循吏傳》：「今大王親近群小，漸漬邪惡所習，存亡之機，不可不慎也。」 「 漬 」也表示疾病。如《呂氏春秋．順民》：「時出行路，從車載食，以視孤寡老弱之漬病困窮顏色愁悴不贍者，必身自食之。」高誘注：「漬，亦病也。」 「 漬 」表示濕潤。《廣韻．寘韻》：「漬，浸潤。」唐代殷堯藩〈送客遊吳〉：「衣逢梅雨漬，船入稻花香。」清代梁章鉅〈遊雁蕩日記〉：「石磴數百級折作數十盤者為安禪谷，同人皆從漬苔石滑中賈勇而登。」 「 漬 」既可表示塵垢積在物體上，如北宋蘇軾〈虛飄飄〉三首之一：「塵漬雨桐葉，霜飛風柳條。」亦可表示積在物體上的污跡，如明代湯顯祖《牡丹亭．回生》：「你看正面上那些兒塵漬，斜空處沒半米蚍蜉。」《紅樓夢》第33回：「王夫人抱着寶玉，只見他面白氣弱，底下穿着一條綠紗小衣，一片皆是血漬。」 「 清 」還表示雨水或眼淚灑落之貌。《類篇．水部》：「漬、洓，雨零皃。」如明代陳汝元《金蓮記．便省》：「白髮傷心，青山漬淚。」清代德亮〈孤花〉：「雨漬猶堪賞，風吹略不禁。」

"Nei Ze": "If you pick up beef, you must kill the new ones, and if you cut it thinly, you will never be right." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "Japanese Book A Type" Jian 113zheng II: "You can stain rice into wine, and the wine is beautiful." " Stain" means staining or contamination. Such as "Zhou Li. Kao Gong Ji. "Zhong's": "Zhong's dyed feathers with Zhuzhan Dan, which burns in March, and stains it." Zheng Xuan's note: "Steam the feathers to stain the feathers. The stains are still stained." "Han Shu. "The Official Biography of the Officials": "Today the king is close to the small group, and the evil is gradually stained. The chance of survival and death must not be careless." " Stain" also means disease. Such as "Lu's Spring and Autumn. "Successful People": "When you travel, you can eat from the car to see the loneliness, old, weak, sick, poor, and melancholic. Those who are poor and sorrowful will eat on their own." Gao Yin noted: "Stains are also sick." " Stain" means wetness. "Guang Yun. "Zhiyun": "Stain, infiltrate." Liang Zhangju of the Qing Dynasty "You Yandang Diary": "Hundreds of stones are folded into dozens The disciple is Anchan Valley, and everyone is climbing from the moss-stained stone slippery." " Stain" can mean the accumulation of dirt on an object, such as one of the three poems of Su Shi's "Xu Piao Piao" in the Northern Song Dynasty: "Dust stains rain tung leaves, frosty wind willow twigs." It can also mean stains accumulated on objects, such as Ming Dynasty Tang Xianzu "Peony Pavilion. "Resurrection": "Look at the dust stains on the front, and there is no half a meter of worms in the oblique space." Chapter 33 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "Madam Wang is holding Baoyu, but he is pale and weak, wearing a green gauze coat underneath. All are blood stains." " Qing" also means the appearance of rain or tears. "Class articles. The Ministry of Water: "Stains, rain, and rain." Such as Chen Ruyuan in the Ming Dynasty "Golden Lotus. 漬字的基本解释

漬
zì
见“渍”。

漬字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zì］
［《廣韻》疾智切，去寘，從。］
亦作“洓3”。“渍1”的繁体字。
(1)腌渍；浸泡。
(2)谓淘。参见“漬米”。
(3)沾染；濡染。
(4)指因接触而受影响。
(5)浸润；湿润。
(6)滑；溜。
(7)聚积（水等液体）。
(8)指积水。
(9)谓尘垢等积在物体上。
(10)积在物体上的滓垢。
(11)谓病重。
(12)指牲畜染疫而死。
[②]［sè］
［《類篇》色責切］
“渍2”的繁体字。
雨或泪洒落。

漬字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　漬； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页647第01
〔古文〕洓【唐韻】前知切【集韻】【韻會】疾智切，?音胔。【說文】漚也。　又浸漬也。【史記·貨殖傳】漸漬於失敎。　又染也。【周禮·冬官考工記】鍾氏染羽，淳而漬之。　又獸死也。【禮·曲禮】四足曰漬。【註】漬謂相瀸汙而死。

考證：〔【禮·曲禮】四足曰漬。【註】漬謂相瀸汙而死。　〕　謹照原文汗改汙。
漬字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
漬字的起名意思

暂无。

Stains
Basic explanation of words
Stains
zì
See "stains".
Stains
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zì］
["Guangyun" swiftly and wisely, go to set, follow. ]
Also known as "Bao 3". Traditional Chinese characters for "Stain 1".
(1) Pickling; soaking.
(2) That is Tao. See "stained rice".
(3) Contaminated; contaminated.
(4) Refers to being affected by contact.
(5) Wetting; Wetting.
(6) Slippery; slippery.
(7) Accumulation (liquid such as water).
(8) Refers to stagnant water.
(9) It is said that dust, etc. accumulate on the object.
(10) The dirt accumulated on the object.
(11) It is said to be seriously ill.
(12) Refers to the death of livestock infected with the disease.
[②]［sè］
["Like Pian" Color Responsibility Cut]
"Stain 2" in traditional characters.
Rain or tears are falling.
Stains
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Siji 1st] [Water Word Department] 　 stains; Kangxi strokes: 15; page number: page 647 01
〔古文〕洓【Tang Yun】Pre-knowledge and cut 【Jiyun】【Rhyme will】quick and wise cut,? Yin 胔. [Said the text] Retting also.　I dipped it again. [Historical Records · The Commodity of Goods] Gradually stained with loss.　I dye it again. 【Zhou Li·Dongguan Kao Gong Ji】Zhong's dyed feathers were pure and stained.　The beast died again. 【Rite·Curly】The four feet are called stains. [Note] Stains means death by filth. Textual research: [[Ritual·Quli] Four-footed said stains. [Note] Stains means death by filth.　〕　 I would like to change the sweat according to the original.

Name meaning

zì
вм. 渍
Radicals: 氵, 生, 貝  (tsunami, life, shellfish)
Meaning Mnemonic
Take some tsunami water and sacrifice the life of a shellfish to make a liquid you can pickle in. All pickling liquids are made from 1 part tsunami and 1 part murdered shellfish.
Imagine stabbing a shellfish and dropping it in some water you collected from a tsunami so that you can make your own pickles.
Reading Mnemonic
You can only pickle two (つ) things with the life of one shellfish. Thats a lot of dead critters for not a lot of delicious pickles. Make sure you get a lot of shellfish if you want a full jar.
Picture the two pickles that shellfish life got you. They're gonna be the best pickles ever!
